page.title: 18An Ordinary Day (Cont.)
page.content:
evenings a week either to netball or to meetings, but the nights I stay in I try to finish work in time to sit down and watch the ten o'clock news.
When Dennis comes in , he has his dinner and we sit andchat over a glass of wine before collapsing into bed about mid-night. We do occasionally go out socially midweek but usually we see friends for a meal or go to a dance or the theatre on Saturday evenings.
Tonight I'm exhausted and gld to get to sleep. I've just dropped off when suddenly I sit bolt upright. As Dennis asks me what's up I reply "Domesday". He looks at me a bit odd and asks if I have been taking the latest film on nuclear scenarios too much to heart. Two hours later and here I am.....!
